intro: Physurus nobilis, commonly known as the noble physurus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
